summary: Maritime tourism refers to the sector of the tourism industry that encompasses travel and leisure activities conducted on or near water bodies, particularly involving maritime vessels. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, maritime tourism is subject to various directives and regulations aimed at ensuring safety, environmental protection, and consumer rights. The EU promotes sustainable maritime tourism through initiatives that encourage responsible practices, enhance maritime infrastructure, and support regional development. Regulatory measures may include compliance with safety standards for vessels, environmental impact assessments, and the protection of maritime heritage, all contributing to the overall enhancement of the maritime tourism experience within the EU.
